Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Java.Lang.RuntimeException: Can't create handler inside thread that has not called Looper.prepare()" (#2065) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. (Preparing testcase. Bare with me.)

### Expected Behavior
Should not crash.

### Actual Behavior

```
System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred. ---> System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> Java.Lang.RuntimeException: Can't create handler inside thread that has not called Looper.prepare()
  at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw () [0x0000c] in <f32579baafc1404fa37ba3ec1abdc0bd>:0
  at Java.Interop.JniEnvironment+InstanceMethods.CallObjectMethod (Java.Interop.JniObjectReference instance, Java.Interop.JniMethodInfo method, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* args) [0x00069] in <7802aa64ad574c33adca332a3fa9706a>:0
  at Java.Interop.JniPeerMembers+JniInstanceMethods.InvokeVirtualObjectMethod (System.String encodedMember, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* parameters) [0x0002a] in <7802aa64ad574c33adca332a3fa9706a>:0
  at Android.App.AlertDialog+Builder.Create () [0x0000a] in <263adecfa58f4c449f1ff56156d886fd>:0
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.PopupManager+PopupRequestHelper.OnAlertRequested (Xamarin.Forms.Page sender, Xamarin.Forms.Internals.AlertArguments arguments) [0x00017] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android\PopupManager.cs:115
  at at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.MonoMethod.InternalInvoke(System.Reflection.MonoMethod,object,object[],System.Exception&)
  at System.Reflection.MonoMethod.Invoke (System.Object obj, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x00032] in <f32579baafc1404fa37ba3ec1abdc0bd>:0
  at java.lang.RuntimeException: Can't create handler inside thread that has not called Looper.prepare()
  at at android.os.Handler.<init>(Handler.java:200)
  at at android.os.Handler.<init>(Handler.java:114)
  at at android.app.Dialog.<init>(Dialog.java:122)
  at at android.app.AlertDialog.<init>(AlertDialog.java:200)
  at at android.app.AlertDialog$Builder.create(AlertDialog.java:1086)
  --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
  at System.Reflection.MonoMethod.Invoke (System.Object obj, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x0004b] in <f32579baafc1404fa37ba3ec1abdc0bd>:0
  at System.Reflection.MethodBase.Invoke (System.Object obj, System.Object[] parameters) [0x00000] in <f32579baafc1404fa37ba3ec1abdc0bd>:0
  at Xamarin.Forms.MessagingCenter+Subscription.InvokeCallback (System.Object sender, System.Object args) [0x00064] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\MessagingCenter.cs:94
  at Xamarin.Forms.MessagingCenter.InnerSend (System.String message, System.Type senderType, System.Type argType, System.Object sender, System.Object args) [0x0006b] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\MessagingCenter.cs:217
  at Xamarin.Forms.MessagingCenter.Xamarin.Forms.IMessagingCenter.Send[TSender,TArgs] (TSender sender, System.String message, TArgs args) [0x00013] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\MessagingCenter.cs:115
  at Xamarin.Forms.MessagingCenter.Send[TSender,TArgs] (TSender sender, System.String message, TArgs args) [0x00000] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\MessagingCenter.cs:108
  at Xamarin.Forms.Page.DisplayAlert (System.String title, System.String message, System.String accept, System.String cancel) [0x0001f] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\Page.cs:148
  at Xamarin.Forms.Page.DisplayAlert (System.String title, System.String message, System.String cancel) [0x00000] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\Page.cs:139
  at GWallet.Frontend.XF.SendPage.AnswerToFee (GWallet.Backend.IAccount account, GWallet.Frontend.XF.TransactionInfo txInfo, System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1[TResult] answer) [0x0007a] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Frontend.XF/SendPage.xaml.fs:321
  at <StartupCode$GWallet-Frontend-XF>.$SendPage.xaml+ShowFeeAndSend@382-3.Invoke (System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1[TResult] delegateArg0) [0x00000] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Frontend.XF/SendPage.xaml.fs:382

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Ensured AndroidApkSigner is run on all APKs" (#2064) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Closed issue "This is a suggestion about xamarin for visual studio" (#1953) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Forgive me for submitting this as an issue to here.Because I don't know where the issue about xamarin for visual studio should be mentioned.

When I wrote these words, I was editing the Android UI using android studio (thanks for [Xamaridea](https://github.com/EgorBo/Xamaridea)).

I think many people in the community have the same feelings as me ([the same scene](https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/39325/using-android-studio-for-axml-editing)).

Xamarin for visual studio has too many problems:
The xml schemas are old and axml intellisense is terrible;
The resource.desinger.cs update is slow;
Axml is severely stuck when it is saved, and sometimes it can even cause visual studio to crash;

These problems have reduced my development efficiency by half. I need to spend a lot of time waiting for visual studio (actually xamarin for visual studio).

I like xamarin, I like visual studio. So, even with android studio for development I have been restraining my impulse to use java for development.

Why can't xamarin get better?

If the development experience on visual studio can achieve the same development experience as android studio, I think that will be an epic enhancement for xamarin.android.

My development environment:
Windows 10
Visual studio 2017 15.7.5
Xamarin.visualstudio 4.10

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] more fixes for parallel builds" (#2063) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2043

Another issue that could crop up from #2043 is:
- Two instances of `ResolveLibraryProjectImports` are run in parallel
- A file is written to at the same time, causing invalid zip files in
  `obj/Debug/lp`, such as a `classes.jar` file

An example error message would be:

    error APT0000: ERROR: unable to open 'obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar' as a zip file: -78 "classes.jar' as a zip file: -78".

Checking the zip file indicates it is corrupted:

    $ zipinfo bin/TestDebug/temp/BuildInParallel/obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar
    Archive:  bin/TestDebug/temp/BuildInParallel/obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar
    [bin/TestDebug/temp/BuildInParallel/obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar]
    End-of-central-directory signature not found.  Either this file is not
    a zipfile, or it constitutes one disk of a multi-part archive.  In the
    latter case the central directory and zipfile comment will be found on
    the last disk(s) of this archive.
    zipinfo:  cannot find zipfile directory in one of bin/TestDebug/temp/BuildInParallel/obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar or
            bin/TestDebug/temp/BuildInParallel/obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar.zip, and cannot find bin/TestDebug/temp/BuildInParallel/obj/Debug/lp/7/jl/bin/classes.jar.ZIP, period.

So an improvement I made to `ResolveLibraryProjectImports`:
- Extract to a temp file
- Use `CopyIfChanged` to the destination
- Delete the temp file

This is generally *safer*, and a good change, in general.

However...

When running the `BuildInParallel` test on Mac, it seems to randomly
fail in other MSBuild tasks!

If I run the test several times, it seems to fail about 1 in 3...

So for now, I think we should ignore the `BuildInParallel` test on Mac
and come back to this later.

It would be *nice* to have a completely robust build that won't break
when run in parallel. Maybe should be something we work on in the
future?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Use a Response file for AOT" (#2062) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/609244

Windows has a limit on the length of command line arguments.
As a result AOT can fail on windows if the project paths
are too long.

mono 2018-06 introduced a `--response=FILE` which allows
us to provide all the options in a file rather than on the
command line directly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[UWP] Fixed double set margins in Layouts" (#3570) at xamarin/
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

In PR https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/2515 there was a mistake due to which all `Margin` properties inside `StackLayout` / `AbsoluteLayout` were applied twice.

### Issues Resolved ###

- fixes #3398 

### API Changes ###

<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem -->

### Platforms Affected ###

- UWP

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

Labels and other elements with `Margin` property are correctly displayed inside in layouts.

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[xcode10] Constraints causing crash" (#4622) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the [attached project](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/2288787/SimpleConstraintTest.zip), run in VSMac 7.5.4 (build 7) configured with the latest web preview for Xcode 10 (associated with beta 5)

2. Notice that **Info.plist** configures the project to target iOS 12 

3. Run on iOS 12 simulator; notice that there is a [constraints-related crash](https://gist.github.com/bradumbaugh/2b3579196d52071c1d993869875519f1)

4. Run on device with iOS 12 installed; there is no crash.

5. Inspect **Main.storyboard** - there is a single UIView with four constraints, which should be enough to fully specify the position and size of the view:

- Left margin
- Right margin
- Top margin
- Height

6. Open [attached Xcode sample](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/2288795/What.zip) in Xcode 10. This is a similarly set-up sample, with a storyboard containing a single view with four analogous constraints.

7. The Xcode-based app deploys to the simulator and displays the view as expected.

Is this issue related to the fact that the Xcode storyboard references safe areas, but the Xamarin storyboard does not?

### Expected Behavior

View should render on simulator as expected.

### Actual Behavior

Crash

### Environment

```
Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 for Mac
Version 7.5.4 (build 7)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[mono-2018-06] mscorlib test failure with mono2018-06" (#4617) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to Xamarin.iOS from mono2018-06 branch, 11.15.0.48 (PR-4277: 3901d8e2)
2. Build and run mscorlib tvOS tests on device

### Expected Behavior
All tests should pass
### Actual Behavior
[FAIL] ParameterInfoTest.ParameterInfoToStringForQueryableSkipWhile :   #1
Tests run: 8041 Passed: 8039 Inconclusive: 1 Failed: 1 Ignored: 38

### Environment

Mono version: 5.16.0.108 (7a9c54ebd45)  (2018-08-13 12:19:08 -04:00) 
XI version: 11.15.0.48 (PR-4277: 3901d8e2) 
XM version: 4.7.0.48 (3901d8e2)  (2018-08-08 06:27:48 -04:00)
XS version: 7.7.0.830 (2dac6bd)  (2018-08-13 12:35:26 -04:00)
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download Xcode 10 beta from apple developer downloads
2. Install the builds from visual studio Xcode 10 preview channel(Xamarin.iOS 11.99)
3. In visual studio tools, change apple sdk path to Xcode beta
4. Try running on real device, it throws errors (Note : Simulators are working fine)

### Expected Behavior
Should compile
### Actual Behavior
Not compiling, Throwing native bindings errors

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Interface Builder - Switching back to VS4M causes the project to be unloaded in Xcode" (#4620) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create new Xamarin iOS Application 2. Right Click Storyboard 3. Open in Interface Builder 4. Edit the ViewController 5. Switch focus back to VS4M 6. Switch focus to Xcode ### Expected Behavior State of Interface Builder should be intact and editing of the Storyboard should be possible. ### Actual Behavior Xcode project is unloaded and no longer Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[mono2018-06]mini test failure on an iOS device" (#4618) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Update System to Xamarin.iOS from mono2018-06 branch, XI version: 11.15.0.48 (PR-4277: 3901d8e2) 
2. Execute mini tests on a device. Tests executed on a 32 bit device with iOS version 9.3.5

### Expected Behavior
All tests should pass
### Actual Behavior
[FAIL] JitTests.Objects :   Expected: 0
### Environment
```
Mono version: 5.16.0.108 (7a9c54ebd45)  (2018-08-13 12:19:08 -04:00)
XI version: 11.15.0.48 (PR-4277: 3901d8e2) 
XM version: 4.7.0.48 (3901d8e2)  (2018-08-08 06:27:48 -04:00)
XS version: 7.7.0.830 (2dac6bd)  (2018-08-13 12:35:26 -04:00)
```

### Build Logs

Build Log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-f43437d114b945608b86a397311eeabf.txt
Test Log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/mscorlib-tvos06-15-2985652fd1ecb4eddd80ebefb1562b316473fa559b06-15-29-5fa48680f8244f2eb519b3941b11efe5.zip
### Example Project (If Possible)

xamarin-macios/tests/mini/mini-ios

Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to Xamarin.iOS from mono2018-06 branch, 11.15.0.48 (PR-4277: 3901d8e2)

### Expected Behavior

### Actual Behavior

Tests run: 8041 Passed: 8039 Inconclusive: 1 Failed: 1 Ignored: 38

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

Need CSSubscriptionManager from CoreSpotlight.framework.
Link with class header:
https://github.com/nst/iOS-Runtime-Headers/blob/master/Frameworks/CoreSpotlight.framework/CSSubscriptionManager.h

### Expected Behavior

CSSuscriptionManager is available for using.

### Actual Behavior

Can't find CSSubscriptionManager in Xamarin

### Environment

### Comment

CSSubscriptionManager is hidden in CoreSpotlight, in xcode i can use it by appending header file of this class.

https://github.com/nst/iOS-Runtime-Headers/blob/master/Frameworks/CoreSpotlight.framework/CSSubscriptionManager.h

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[d15-9] Order additional arguments after response file (#4607)" (#4612) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4594
- There were being adding _before_ the response file which meant options that were overriding defaults were not being honored
